DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Urine Protein to Creatinine Ratio Measurement Outcome 2 Decimal Place Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The 2 decimal place numeric laboratory value measured, assigned or computed related to the assessment of the urine protein to creatinine ratio measurement.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Urine Protein to Creatinine Ratio Measurement Outcome
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._The fluid that is excreted by the kidneys.  It is stored in the bladder and discharged through the urethra._The determination of the ratio of total protein compared to creatinine present in a sample. The measurement may be expressed as a ratio or percentage._The result of an action.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredName: Urine Protein to Creatinine Ratio Measurement Outcome
Property.preferredDefinition: The fluid that is excreted by the kidneys.  It is stored in the bladder and discharged through the urethra.:The determination of the ratio of total protein compared to creatinine present in a sample. Concepts.definition: The fluid that is excreted by the kidneys.  It is stored in the bladder and discharged through the urethra.
The determination of the ratio of total protein compared to creatinine present in a sample. The measurement may be expressed as a ratio or percentage.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Outcome Integer::2 Decimal Place Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::2_An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Outcome Integer::2 Decimal Place Value
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood, urine, or other substance from the body. Tests can help determine a diagnosis, plan treatment, check to see if treatment is working, or monitor the disease over time.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.:A number with no fractional part.::2:An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
